br.com.depasser.web.resource
Class Type

java.lang.Object
  br.com.depasser.web.resource.Type
Direct Known Subclasses:
JavascriptType, StylesheetType
public abstract class Type
extends java.lang.Object

A resource type identifies and gives some information about a specific content type. Typical resource type examples are javascript and stylesheets.

Author:
Vinicius Isola (viniciusisola@gmail.com)

Constructor Detail

Type

public Type()
Method Detail

getAttributeName

public abstract java.lang.String getAttributeName()
Return the attribute name that should be used to set the path to the resource for the HTML tag. Example: javascript uses the "script" tag with the "src" attribute, so this should return "src".

Returns:
The attribute name.

getContentType

public abstract java.lang.String getContentType()
Must return the mime type for this type.

Returns:
MIME type for this resource type.

getOtherAttributes

public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getOtherAttributes()
Return all other attributes that should be added to the HTML tag to identify a resource of this type. This can include attributes like "type" and "rel" for a "link" tag, for example.

Returns:
A map containing all other attributes and its values or null if no other attribute is necessary.

getProcessors

public java.util.List<Processor> getProcessors()
Return a list containing all the processors available for this type. They must be sorted in the order the content should be handled by each one.

Returns:
A list with all processors or null if none available.

getSupportedTypes

public abstract java.lang.String[] getSupportedTypes()
A list of strings that the user could use to reach this specified resource type. For example, for a javascript file this could be: javascript, script, js, etc.

Returns:

getTagName

public abstract java.lang.String getTagName()
Return the tag name that is used to load resources of this type from an HTML page. Example: javascript = "script"

Returns:
The tag name.
